intro: Gutierrezia wrightii, commonly known as Wright's goldenweed, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its yellow composite flowers and linear, gray-green leaves. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is often found in desert scrub and grassland habitats. It produces small, wind-dispersed seeds and plays a role in stabilizing soil in arid environments. Gutierrezia wrightii is adapted to hot, dry climates and is drought-tolerant, making it a resilient component of its ecosystem.
